intro: Gutierrezia linearifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and shrublands, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its linear, grass-like leaves and yellow flowers make it a distinctive species in its habitat. It is also known for its use in traditional herbal medicine and as a source of nectar for pollinators.
